lines.text: I am the Lizard King. I can do anything.
Actually, I don't remember being born. It must have happened during one of my blackouts.
Where's your will to be weird?
Some of the worst mistakes of my life have been haircuts.
You're all a bunch of fuckin' slaves! How much longer are you gonna let them push you around?
Name, occupation?
Pamela Morrison, ornament.
Name, occupation?
Robby Krieger, guitar player.
Name, occupation?
John Densmore, percussionist, 23 years old. Far out, man!
Name, occupation?
Raymond Daniel Manzarek, born February 12th 1939, musician, organist.
Name, occupation?
Uh, Jim.
[smiles]

[first lines; Jim has just climbed a tree to Pam's room]
Hi.
Hi.
[pause]
Don't you believe in doors?
A waste of time.
I believe in a long prolonged derangement of the senses to attain the unknown... Although I live in the subconscious, our pale reason hides the infinite from us.
Hatred is a very underestimated emotion.
This is the strangest life I've ever known.
Let's plan a murder or start a religion.
I'm the poet and you're my muse.
Come on, let's get some tacos.

[quoted in Jim Morrison's film class project]
Nietzsche said, "All great things must first wear terrifying and monstrous masks in order to inscribe themselves on the hearts of humanity."
Adolf Hitler is alive and well and living in Miami! I fucked her last night!
I don't know if I want to take acid.
Relax, it's peyote.
Do you believe in drugs?
I believe in excess...
I feel the universe functioning perfectly but I'm still perfectly locked inside myself. Instead of oneness, I feel isolation.
Love, death, travel, revolt, chaos.
You actually put your dick in this woman?
Well... sometimes, yeah.
Somebody gave me this telephone... I think it was Edie... yeah it was Edie... and she said I could talk to God with it, but uh... I don't have anything to say... so here...
[giving Jim the phone]
this is for you... now you can talk to God.
They don't want me - they want my *death*!
We're gonna fuck death away!
I'm afraid of my father. I can't be what they want me to be.
Maybe you should kill your father.
I'm gonna get my kicks before the whole shithouse goes up in flames.
[after Pamela and Jim's fight over the duck]
Jim, will you stop this shit! Will you get sane!

[Imitating Bob Dylan's singing voice]
Johnny's in the basement mixing up the medicine, I'm on the pavement thinking about the government.
I was stoned. It seemed like a fun thing to do at the time.
You killed my duck!
I killed your duck?
[stomps on the duck]
And I'm still killing your fucking duck. There! Murder! Death! Duck! Dead! Death fucking dead! There, the duck is dead!

[to Jim]
Whatcha gonna do for act three, man? Puke on Heaven's door?
Father, "yes son", I want to kill you.
Mother. I want to fuck you.
What's wrong with being a large mammal?
[during their peyote trip in the desert]

Close your eyes. We'll see the snake; see the serpent appear. His head is ten feet long and five feet wide. He has one red eye and one green eye. He's seven miles long. Deadly. I see all the history of the world on his scales, all people, all actions. We're all just little pictures on his scales. God, he's big, he's moving, devouring consciousness, digesting power. Monster of energy. It's a monster. We're going to kiss the snake on the tongue. Kiss the serpent. But if it senses fear, it'll eat us instantly. But if we kiss it without fear, it'll take us through the garden, through the gate, to the other side. Ride the snake... until the end of time.
I think I'm fucked up, man. I'm not thinking right.
[Jim tilts his head back and laughs lazily]
Look at your eyes, man... your death.
Andy Warhol IS art. We must ask ourselves, does Andy imitate life or does life imitate Andy?
I love fame, I *do* love fame!
I'm a fake hero.
Have you ever eaten human flesh?

[to Jim]
You're a poet, not a rock star.
Excuse me, sir. Who's flying this plane right now?
Teenage death girls want my dick not my words.

[stands up]
I'm lying, I *am* afraid.
[Jim turns around and walks away]

[calling after him]
Jim! Don't go away! Come dance with me!
I think I'm having a nervous breakdown.
